title: Morgan Freeman gives Tiffany Haddish side eye as she takes selfie
text:
We’d pay to know what Morgan was thinking (Picture: Tiffany Haddish, Instagram)

Morgan Freeman didn’t look too impressed when Tiffany Haddish popped up to take an impromptu selfie with him last night.

The Girls Trip actress attended the Mark Twain Prize For American Humor awards on Saturday night, and clearly had the time of her life mingling in the audience.

Not one to miss an opportunity to meet one of her Hollywood faves, Tiffany couldn’t help but take her chance with Morgan when she spotted him in the audience at the Kennedy Center Concert Hall in Washington DC.

In an Instagram selfie, Tiffany looks like the cat that got the cream with a big smile on her face as Morgan sits down looking up at her with the ultimate side eye.

Explaining the situation with her brilliant trademark wit, the 39-year-old wrote in the caption: ‘I ran up on @morganfreeman and he check the Hell out of me and I didn’t care.

‘Cause like I told him “I am Tiffany MotherF**king Haddish and I take pictures all the time ShE Ready” …. love you #morganfreeman#marktwainprize [sic].’

Tiffany’s followers were thoroughly entertained by the selfie, including one who commented: ‘His face is not havin it!!! Omg thank you for this.’

Another joked: ‘Morgan: why is the waitress taking my picture, where is the drink i ordered [sic],’ while another said: ‘Morgan is OVER IT.’

‘LOL.. I KNOW HE DID #GrownFolksDon’tPlay [sic],’ one said.

Believing that Morgan, 82, took a particular shine to Tiffany, another weighed in: ‘He looking at you like a hot buttered biscuit.’

Another quipped: ‘Morgan looking like “i just told you No pics!!!”’

Whatever Morgan was thinking, it’s made for one iconic picture.

Comedian Dave Chappelle was the man of the night as he was honoured with the Mark Twain Prize, which is considered to be the highest accolade in comedy, and recognises those who have had an impact on American society similar to novelist Samuel Clemens, also known as Mark Twain.

The night saw tributes from the likes of Bradley Cooper, John Legend, Chrissy Teigen, Trevor Noah, Common, Jon Stewart and Dave’s writing partner Neal Brennan.

Honouring the legendary comedian, Tiffany wrote in an Instagram post: ‘It was fun getting dressed up to celebrate my big brother Dave Chappelle thank you to my team for making me look like this.’
